questions.question: What is the internet?
questions.explanation: Internet: interconnected computer networks. Purpose: data exchange globally. Scale: billions of devices connected. Infrastructure: routers, cables, satellites. Access: ISP required typically. Impact: transformed communication, commerce.

questions.question: What provides internet?
questions.explanation: ISP: provides internet access. Services: residential, business, mobile. Technologies: DSL, cable, fiber, satellite. Speeds: varies by type, location. Competition: prices vary by region. Uptime: reliability important.

questions.question: What is broadband?
questions.explanation: Broadband: high-speed internet connection. Speeds: typically 25+ Mbps minimum. Types: cable, fiber, DSL, satellite. Benefits: streaming, gaming, video calls possible. Standards: FCC defines threshold. Penetration: increasing globally.

questions.question: What is WiFi?
questions.explanation: WiFi: wireless network technology. Standard: IEEE 802.11 protocols. Range: 30-100 meters typical. Speed: 802.11ax (WiFi 6) fastest. Channels: 2.4/5GHz bands. Security: WPA2/WPA3 encryption. Convenience: no cables needed.

questions.question: What is a router?
questions.explanation: Router: connects devices to internet. Function: forwards data packets. Features: WiFi broadcast, firewall, NAT. Types: residential, enterprise. Speed: determines throughput. Security: built-in protection typically. Wireless: extends coverage.

questions.question: What is a modem?
questions.explanation: Modem: device converting ISP signal. Acronym: MOdulator-DEModulator. Types: cable, DSL, fiber. Speed: determined by ISP. Connection: to router typical. Setup: initial configuration needed. Replacement: every 5+ years typical.

questions.question: What is DNS?
questions.explanation: DNS: translates domain names to IP addresses. Purpose: make web browseable. Examples: example.com  93.184.216.34. Servers: distributed globally. Caching: speeds up lookups. DNSSEC: security enhancement.

questions.question: What is an IP address?
questions.explanation: IP address: identifies devices on network. Versions: IPv4 (dotted decimal), IPv6 (hexadecimal). Format: IPv4 example 192.168.1.1. Purpose: routing data packets. Assignment: DHCP automatic typical. Static: fixed addresses available.

questions.question: What are protocols?
questions.explanation: Protocols: agreed-upon communication rules. Examples: TCP/IP, HTTP, SMTP. Purpose: ensure compatibility. Layers: OSI model defines structure. Implementation: built into software. Standards: international organizations maintain.

questions.question: What is bandwidth?
questions.explanation: Bandwidth: speed of data transfer. Measured: Mbps or Gbps. Factors: ISP service, distance, congestion. Usage: streaming, downloads affect. Throttling: ISP limits possible. Importance: determines experience quality.
